items.name: Uptown Veg (Harlem)
items.description: Vegan soul food with 2 Harlem locations. Buffet style.

items.name: Bunna Cafe (Bushwick)
items.description: Vegan Ethiopian food. Come with friends and get the platter to share.

items.name: Spicy Moon (Multiple but East Village is best)
items.description: Most popular vegan restaurant in the city. Get the dry pepper style tofu.

items.name: Cafe Clementine (Clinton Hill)
items.description: Super cute vegan cafe. Try all the pastries you can.

items.name: Very Fresh Noodles (Chelsea)
items.description: Hand-pulled noodles in Chelsea Market. Get the vegan dry duck noodles and tofu pudding.

items.name: Yough (Bushwick)
items.description: All vegan bodega. So many sandwiches, snaclss and treats.

items.name: Buddha Bodai (Chinatown)
items.description: 5 Mott St. All day dim sum. Get anything with the BBQ pork.

items.name: Screamers Pizzeria (Crown Heights)
items.description: The only all-vegan pizzeria in the city. Get the buffalo cauliflower slice.

items.name: NY Dosas (Greenwich Village)
items.description: Tasty dosa cart in Washington Square Park. Check their Insta for time and arrive early.

items.name: Spring Cafe (Chinatown)
items.description: Tiny cafe above the Canal St. station. Get the vegan bao combo.

items.name: Sen Saigon (Chinatown)
items.description: Best Viet food in the city. Everything is good.

items.name: Dayglow (Bushwick)
items.description: Hipster Bushwich coffee shop. Best cup I've had in the city.

items.name: Tofubox (Williamsburg)
items.description: No frills vegan chinese. Their box meals are an amazing deal.

items.name: Lakruwana Restaurant (Staten Island)
items.description: Sri Lankan food. Worth the ferry ride for the Saturday buffet.

items.name: Fong On (Chinatown)
items.description: Nearly 100 year old tofu-shop in Chinatown. Get the savory bowl (no shrimp) and some rice cakes.

items.name: BOs Bagels (Harlem)
items.description: Locations in Harlem and Wash Heights. Tofu maple walnut is the best spread I've had in the city.

items.name: Roti Roll (Morningside Heights)
items.description: Open until 3am most days. Get 2 chana masala rolls.

items.name: Queens Night Market (Flushing)
items.description: Seasonal food market in Flushing Meadows Corona Park. The widest array of cuisines you'll ever see. Everything is $5.

items.name: MoMA (Midtown)
items.description: Way better than I expected. Super fun with friends.

items.name: Poster House (Flatiron)
items.description: Favorite museum in the city. Always something new and interesting and it only takes an hour to see everything.

items.name: Noguchi Museum (Astoria)
items.description: Former house now museum of Isamu Noguchi. A peaceful oasis in suburban Queens.

items.name: Storm King Art Center (New Windsor)
items.description: You can get to this 200 acre scuplyure park for $60 and a 1 hour bus from Port Authority. Most magical place in the Hudson Valley.

items.name: Dia Beacon (Beacon)
items.description: Best art museum in the state. Take the metro north 1.5 hours and spend the day in the town.

items.name: City Island (Bronx)
items.description: So far away you won't believe you're still in NYC. It's like a small New England town within the city limits.

items.name: Hell Gate Bike Path (Randalls Island)
items.description: Ride a city bike around the island and see the marshes (and take lots of photos).

items.name: Governors Island
items.description: $5 10 minute ferry gets you to this car free oasis with hundreds of acres of parks, art galleriers, and conservation projects

items.name: Williamsburg Bridge
items.description: Ride an electric Citi from Brooklyn -> Manhattan at sundown.

items.name: Washington Square Park (Greenwich Village)
items.description: Get a dosa and just sit and watch around the fountain for an hour.

items.name: Domino Park (Williamsburg)
items.description: The whole stretch of waterfront from Williamsburg to Greenpoint is amazing. Domino Park is the best part.
